result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

8:47 AM Defendant Megan L Breternitz in court.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Megan L Breternitz.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Broze requests a status date in this matter and updates the court as to the status of the matter. 
State will forward offer to defense. 
Court will set matter for plea and sentencing hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Case called at 9:00 AM
Attorney Andrew Nettesheim in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Megan L Breternitz.  
Defendant Megan L Breternitz in court. 
Atorney Broze requests another hearing date.  Court grants.

dated 9/16/22 from WCS re: compliance report
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 08-30-2022 received and filed.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant ordered to CAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services for following program protocol for those that are low risk, unless otherwise ordered by the court. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM monitoring. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM monitoring pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

2:17 PM Defendant Megan L Breternitz in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto.  State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula .Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
